title.narrative: INSTITUTIONAL CAPACITY -PROVINCIAL LEVEL

description.narrative: Legal (including juvenile justice) and social services at the provincial levels have increase institutional capacity to protect children, which contributes to Child Protection And Emergencies, Child Protection Systems, Justice For Children, Prevention Of Harmful Practice, Promotion Of Care, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being And Justice, Protection From Violence, Exploitation, Abuse And Neglect, Violence, Exploitation And Abuse. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2021, boys and girls in Thailand are increasingly protected from violence, neglect and exploitation

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Legal (including juvenile justice) and social services at the provincial levels have increase institutional capacity to protectchildren

description.narrative: The institutional capacity of social services strengthened through piloting the Child Protection Service Standards and Supervision System for Competent Officers; the initial adoption of the case management information system, Primero, in hospitals; the development of SOPs for Migrant Child Protection; and the placement of a social worker at the Mae Sot Immigration Detention Centre and at DCY to provide migrant children with child protection services. Legal and juvenile justice services were supported with the revision of guiding manuals and tools on Juvenile and Family Litigation, Child Protection capacity building, and the promotion of alternatives to detention. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:01/02/2022
